title: Generative AI
content:
Module 2, Lesson 9: Generative AI

Introduction

Generative AI — LLMs, diffusion models — is the most visible AI breakthrough of the 2020s. India is the second largest ChatGPT user base globally.

Key Concepts

1. Large Language Models (GPT-4, Gemini, Llama)

Understanding Large Language Models (GPT-4, Gemini, Llama) is foundational to this topic. Indian companies and research institutions apply these principles in production AI systems every day.

2. Diffusion models (Stable Diffusion, DALL-E)

Diffusion models (Stable Diffusion, DALL-E) forms the core methodology for practitioners. India's tech ecosystem from Bengaluru to Hyderabad deploys these approaches at scale.

3. Prompt engineering for Indian contexts

Prompt engineering for Indian contexts is critical for building reliable AI solutions. Top Indian firms like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and startups like Razorpay all leverage these techniques.

4. Risks: hallucinations, deepfakes, misinformation

Mastering Risks: hallucinations, deepfakes, misinformation separates good practitioners from great ones. Apply these concepts on Indian open datasets from data.gov.in to build hands-on expertise.

Summary

This lesson covered Large Language Models (GPT-4, Gemini, Llama), Diffusion models (Stable Diffusion, DALL-E), Prompt engineering for Indian contexts, and Risks: hallucinations, deepfakes, misinformation. These are the building blocks of generative ai — master them through practice on real Indian datasets.
